com.example.progetto.csvClasses.csvRetrieve

Class CsvSplitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.progetto.csvClasses.csvRetrieve.CsvSplitter

  • public class CsvSplitter
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to split all the row of the csv and to get all the data of the fields from the rows

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> commonSeparator 
      private GetCsvDataFromUrl csv 
      private java.lang.String firstLine 
      private java.lang.String sep 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CsvSplitter(GetCsvDataFromUrl csv)
      Constructor of the class CsvSplitter

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void addCommonSeparator(java.lang.String sep)
      add another separator to the collection of common separator
      (package private) void guessDelimiter()
      method used to guess the delimiter of the csv fields, the guessing is made with trying a set of common separator and verify if splitting the first line and the second line result in the same amount of element
      void setDelimiter(java.lang.String sep)
      method used to get the first line and to set the separator, this method must be called before the method splitLine().
      java.lang.String[] splitFirstLine()
      method used to split the first line with the separator, calling this method does't influence the functionality of splitLine() because it use a stored first line and it does't re-read it from the csv.
      java.lang.String[] splitLine()
      method used to split the every line of the csv other than the first line, this method can be used as iterable that return null at the end

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • csv

        private GetCsvDataFromUrl csv

      • commonSeparator

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> commonSeparator

      • sep

        private java.lang.String sep

      • firstLine

        private java.lang.String firstLine

    • Constructor Detail

      • CsvSplitter

        public CsvSplitter(GetCsvDataFromUrl csv)
        Constructor of the class CsvSplitter
        Parameters:
        csv - the csv reader object that wrap a BufferedReader that read the csv data from the url

    • Method Detail

      • guessDelimiter

        void guessDelimiter()
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        method used to guess the delimiter of the csv fields, the guessing is made with trying a set of common separator and verify if splitting the first line and the second line result in the same amount of element
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case that the BufferedReader used in GetCsvDataFromUrl fails
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - in case the csv have a delimiter that are not in commonSeparator

      • addCommonSeparator

        void addCommonSeparator(java.lang.String sep)
        add another separator to the collection of common separator
        Parameters:
        sep - string that will be used to split every row of the csv

      • setDelimiter

        public void setDelimiter(java.lang.String sep)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        method used to get the first line and to set the separator, this method must be called before the method splitLine().
        Parameters:
        sep - separator to use how a split of the line
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error of I/O

      • splitFirstLine

        public java.lang.String[] splitFirstLine()
        method used to split the first line with the separator, calling this method does't influence the functionality of splitLine() because it use a stored first line and it does't re-read it from the csv.
        Returns:
        the first line split in form of a string array

      • splitLine

        public java.lang.String[] splitLine()
        method used to split the every line of the csv other than the first line, this method can be used as iterable that return null at the end
        Returns:
        the array where every element will be a field of the row. if this method return null it means that the file reached the end or that something went wrong on reading the csv
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is invoked before setting or guessing the separator of the csv
